intro: Strychnos tieute, commonly known as the African poison bean, is a deciduous shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces woody, serpentine pods that contain toxic seeds, which are used in traditional medicine despite their potent alkaloids. Its toxic properties make it a significant plant in both ecological and pharmacological contexts.
